newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SCA buys into WELPA, option for control.
newsitem.headline: SCA buys into WELPA, option for control.

text.p: Swedish forestry group SCA said on Monday its packaging division had bought a minority stake in Austria's WELPA with an option to become the majority owner at a later date.

WELPA (Wellpappenfabrk Ges.m.b.H.), an integrated corrugated board plant, has 130 employees, a 10 percent market share in Austria and a 1996 turnover of about 163 million crowns, SCA said in a statement.
"After the acquisition WELPA will coordinate SCA Packaging's sales in Austria," SCA said.
"The acquisition of WELPA sharply strengthens SCA's presence in central Europe."
SCA expected its total central European production to amount to 100-120 million square meters in 2000, corresponding to a market share of 10-12 percent.
